revised_title: Initiation and Growth of Explosion in Solids: Optical and Electrical Properties of Silver Azide
tldr: The authors studied the optical and electrical properties of silver azide, exploring its relation to its decomposition. They found that the absorption of light in the crystal results in the production of excitons, which dissociate into free electrons and positive holes, leading to the initiation of the decomposition process. The primary photocurrent was found to be proportional to the strength of the applied electric field, and the activation energy for photoconductivity was measured as 0.36 eV.
